title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.8.1-2 | 28-01-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: We are beginning a new chapter in the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, The 8th chapter is entitled Prayers by Queen Kunti and Pariksit Saved.
segments.summary: HH Stoka Krishna Swami introduces the 8th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, focusing on the prayers of Queen Kunti and the saving of Pariksit.
segments.transcript: In this session, we are going to learn about... We are beginning a new chapter in the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, the 8th chapter. The 8th chapter is entitled, "Prayers by Queen Kunti and Pariksit Saved." These are the two major topics in this chapter. The first verse: Suta Vacha Atate Samparetanam Svanam Udakam Ichchatam Datum Sa Krishna Gangayam Kritya Yayostriyaha. The meaning of this verse, the first verse of this 8th chapter of the first canto of Bhagavatam: Suta Goswami said, "Thereafter the Pandavas, desiring to deliver water to their dead relatives who had desired it, went to the Ganges with Draupadi. The ladies walked in front."

segments.key_quote: So in the end Ashwatthama's life was spared, But Draupadi lost her five sons, So the Pandavas, Desiring to deliver water, To the dead relatives, They had to do the last rituals, The final rites, For the departed souls, So they went to the Ganges, With Draupadi.
segments.summary: The speaker summarizes the events of the previous chapter, leading to the Pandavas' journey to the Ganges to perform rituals for their deceased relatives.
segments.transcript: So the previous chapter described how the five sleeping sons of Draupadi were actually beheaded by Ashwatthama. And in order to punish Ashwatthama, there was a very big description of the effort involved and the actual suitable punishment that is to be given to him as an aggressor, as a Brahma Bandhu, as the son of the military teacher to whom the Pandavas were very much indebted, like that. So in the end, Ashwatthama's life was spared, but Draupadi lost her five sons. So the Pandavas, desiring to deliver water to the dead relatives, they had to do the last rituals, the final rites, for the departed souls. So they went to the Ganges with Draupadi.

segments.key_quote: Today it is the custom in Hindu society, To go to the Ganges or any other sacred river, To take bath when death occurs in the family.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada's explanation of the ritual of bathing in the Ganges after a death in the family is presented, emphasizing its historical roots and connection to the Dharmashastras.
segments.transcript: So Srila Prabhupada explains this particular ritual. Srila Prabhupada says in the purport, "Today it is the custom in Hindu society to go to the Ganges or any other sacred river to take bath when death occurs in the family." Death is an inevitable part of life. That life is an inevitable part of life. That life in this body has always got a beginning and an end. So the end of life in this body is called death. And according to Bhagavad Gita, the real person inside the body, the soul, quits the body or is forced to quit the body at the time of death, at the end of this life. So when death occurs, it is the tradition and custom to go to some sacred river and take bath. And moreover, it is described here by Srila Prabhupada, each of the family members pours out a pot full of the Ganges water for the departed soul and walks in a procession with the ladies in the front. So those of you who are familiar with this custom, the rituals that are performed, one of the important rituals is called Dharmodaka, offering water. Udaka means water, offering water for the departed soul according to the particular described method in the Dharmashastras. The Pandavas also followed the rules more than 5000 years ago. So these customs and traditions and the particular rituals mentioned in Dharmashastra are not something new that has been invented now. It has always existed in human society, and it was followed by the Pandavas 5000 years ago because this is a historical record, the Srimad Bhagavatam's historical record of what happened 5000 years back when the Pandavas and Kauravas were present on this earth.

segments.key_quote: Lord Krishna, Who is Lord Krishna, The supreme personality of God, Being a cousin of the Pandavas, Was also amongst the, Family members.
segments.summary: The speaker highlights Lord Krishna's presence among the Pandavas as their cousin, explaining the family relationship through Kunti and Vasudeva.
segments.transcript: Now the most important point here is Lord Krishna. Who is Lord Krishna? The supreme personality of God. Being a cousin of the Pandavas, was also amongst the family members. So Krishna, how was he a cousin of the Pandavas? The Pandavas' mother, Kunti, was the sister of Krishna's father, Vasudeva. Vasudeva and Kunti were brother and sister. So therefore, Vasudeva's son, Krishna, and Kunti's sons, the Pandavas, were cousins. That's how it is described. Krishna, being a cousin of the Pandavas, was also amongst the family members. Now Krishna, what role he is going to play, will be described in a verse a little later. He was also there present in this while this ritual was being performed.

segments.key_quote: Having lamented over them and sufficiently offered Ganges water they bathed in the Ganges, whose water is sanctified due to being mixed with the dust of the lotus feet of the lord.
segments.summary: The second verse of the chapter is recited and explained, emphasizing the sanctification of the Ganges due to its association with the lotus feet of Lord Krishna.
segments.transcript: Of this eighth chapter of the first canto, of the next verse, the following verse: Te niniyodakamsarve Vilapya cha Vrishampunah Aplutaharipadapja Rajapuuta Sarigjale. The meaning of this second verse of this eighth chapter of the first canto of Shri Bhagavatam: Having lamented that Krishna is a cousin of Krishna, he was also present, having lamented over them and sufficiently offered Ganges water, they bathed in the Ganges, whose water is sanctified due to being mixed with the dust of the lotus feet of the Lord. This is very significant. They were taking bath in the Ganges River. Now what is a special thing about the Ganges River? We all know it is very, very sacred, it's very holy, it's sanctified. Why that is being mentioned here in the Bhagavatam in this verse? It is because the water of the Ganges is mixed with the dust of the lotus feet of Lord Krishna.

segments.key_quote: So the bhagavatam itself describes a pastime, of lord krishna in his incarnation as vaman dev, when vamana wanted, to restore the kingdom of the, of the heavenly planets to indra the son of aditi aditi prayed to the supreme lord vishnu, and said my sons have lost their kingdom, kindly restore it to them so the lord being pleased with the worship of aditi, agreed to simply, become her son appear as her son and that was the incarnation of the lord as the son of aditi
segments.summary: The speaker narrates the story of Lord Krishna's Vamana avatar, focusing on his request for land from Bali Maharaj and his subsequent expansion to cover the universe.
segments.transcript: So the Bhagavatam itself describes a pastime of Lord Krishna in his incarnation as Vaman Dev. When Vamana wanted to restore the kingdom of the heavenly planets to Indra, the son of Aditi, Aditi prayed to the Supreme Lord Vishnu and said, "My sons have lost their kingdom, kindly restore it to them." So the Lord, being pleased with the worship of Aditi, agreed to simply become her son, appear as her son, and that was the incarnation of the Lord as the son of Aditi. His name was Vamana. Vamana incarnation of the Lord is Vamana. He appeared as a small dwar brahmachari boy. That was the form in which he appeared. That's why Vamana, Vamana means a dwarf in some script. And then this Vamana went to Bali Maharaj, who was ruling the heavenly planets, having conquered the heavenly kingdom, and on behalf of the asuras, Bali Maharaj is ruling. So he, and Bali Maharaj is performing sacrifices. So Vamana, disguised as a brahmachari boy, the Supreme Lord Vishnu disguised as a brahmachari boy, he simply went to that arena, sacrificial arena of Bali Maharaj, and asked him, "I want a donation, three paces of land measured according to my footstep." So Bali Maharaj initially was hesitant to give that small quantity of donation, which he thought, small boy doesn't have experience asking donation. So, Bali Maharaj said, "I can give you so much donation, why are you asking for just three steps of land?" Then Vaman Dev said, "I should be satisfied with what is the bare minimum necessity," and he spoke very brilliantly telling that there is no end to greed. And anyway, Bali Maharaj thought this Brahmachari boy is speaking very intelligently, very nicely. So, he actually agreed to give that donation, and what did Vaman Dev do? He expanded himself to cover the entire universe in two steps. And, when he stretched out his leg to cover the upper portion above the earth, all the planets, until the covering of the universe, the first step. Then the toe of his foot pierced the coverings of the universe. That's very significant because the universe is covered by seven layers. Each layer being...

segments.key_quote: So, the water from the Karna ocean leaked inside this universe. And that water, as it came into the universe, through the hole created by Vamana piercing the shell of the universe, that water washed the lotus feet of Vamandev, who is Vishnu, who is the Supreme Lord. And that is called Ganga.
segments.summary: The lecture concludes with an explanation of the origin of the Ganges, its spiritual potency due to washing the lotus feet of Vamana, and its ability to purify individuals and benefit departed souls.
segments.transcript: So, like that, 4 quadrillion miles, like that the thickness of the layers. So, all those layers, the Supreme Lord pierced by merely pushing his toe into the shell of the universe. And what happened? Because these universes are situated in the Karna ocean, causal ocean. So, the water from the Karna ocean leaked inside this universe. And that water, as it came into the universe, through the hole created by Vamana piercing the shell of the universe, that water washed the lotus feet of Vamandev, who is Vishnu, who is the Supreme Lord. And that is called Ganga. So, therefore, here it is said, the water of the Ganges is sanctified because it is mixed with the dust of the lotus feet of the Supreme Lord. So, therefore, Ganga Jal is spiritually potent. It is spiritually potent because it contains the dust of the lotus feet of the Supreme Lord Krishna. And that's the reason why anybody takes bath in the Ganges. People swim in the Ganges River. They are completely purified of all sinful reactions. When they offer that Ganges water to the departed soul, the departed soul also is actually benefited in several ways. Actions are actually cleared away when the soul is offered Ganga Jal, because the Ganga Jal is sanctified water because of being mixed with the dust of the lotus feet of the Supreme Lord. So, I will stop here. Thank you very much.
